docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 -- The three-month deadlock over the choice of a new Secretary General for the 23-nation Organization of American States was reported today to be on the verge of solution.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 10 -- The three-month deadlock over the choice of a new Secretary General for the 23-nation Organization of American States was reported today to be on the verge of solution.

docs.snippet: THE middle - aged, middle - class Peruvian should have looked jubilant. He had picked up his newspaper that mid-October morning and found that, overnight, the Government had decreed a 10 per cent wage increase for everybody. Starting the next month,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE middle - aged, middle - class Peruvian should have looked jubilant. He had picked up his newspaper that mid-October morning and found that, overnight, the Government had decreed a 10 per cent wage increase for everybody. Starting the next month, he would get an additional wage of 350 sols, which was a bigger percentage jump by far than Walter Reuther won for his automobile workers in the United States that month.
docs.abstract: E L Dale Jr article analyzing history of inflation in US, factors involved, and concluding that serious inflation in future is not inevitable despite current 'inflation psychology' and state of pessimism; holds that only Fed Govt, through fiscal and monetary policies, can curb total demand; drawings; illus

headline.main: Despite our current 'inflation psychology,'; A Serious Inflation Is not in the Cards

docs.snippet: Special to The New York Times WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 -- Eduardo Ritter Aislan of Panama withdrew today as candidate for the position of Secretary General of the Organization of American States.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 -- Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador, was elected Secretary General of the Organization of American States today. He will take office May 17.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 13 -- Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador, was elected Secretary General of the Organization of American States today. He will take office May 17.

headline.main: ECUADORIAN WINS TOP POST IN O.A.S; Voting Begun Nov. 17 Ends With Plaza's Election

docs.snippet: MIAMI, Feb. 13 -- A race that has been won by some of the best-known fillies and mares in modern thoroughbred history will have its 26th running at Hialeah Park tomorrow. The Columbiana, at seven furlongs, has attracted a dozen starters, and first...
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, Feb. 13 -- A race that has been won by some of the best-known fillies and mares in modern thoroughbred history will have its 26th running at Hialeah Park tomorrow. The Columbiana, at seven furlongs, has attracted a dozen starters, and first money of the gross purse of $32,450 will be $21,092.

headline.main: Codorniz, Import From Uruguay, Is Favored in Columbiana at Hialeah Today; $32,450 HANDICAP DRAWS FIELD OF 12

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14 -- President Johnson announced today that the United States would adhere -- with reservations -- to a treaty among Latin-American nations banning nuclear weapons from their territories.
